text:
OK. BEFORE I
START CLASS,

I WANT TO REMIND
YOU ALL THAT YOUR
GRANDMOTHER

IS COMING
FOR A VISIT,

AND SINCE SHE'S
YOUR MOTHER'S
MOTHER

AND NOT MY MOTHER,
SHE DOESN'T KNOW
ANYTHING
ABOUT ALL OF THIS.

YOU MEAN, HOW YOU WON'T
TURN ON THE A/C IN HERE?

NO. I'M TALKING
ABOUT MAGIC,

AND WHEN GRANDMA'S
HERE, NO ONE
USES MAGIC

OR TALKS
ABOUT MAGIC.

GOT IT.
DONE.
WE KNOW, DAD.

NOW. LET'S TALK
ABOUT MAGIC.

THE SPELL FOR TODAY--
BODY SWITCHING.

AWESOME. ALEX, YOU AND ME
SWITCH SEATS.
MAX, THAT'S NOT MAGIC.

DAD, SHE NEVER
LETS ME SIT THERE.

IT WOULD BE
KIND OF MAGICAL.

FINE. SWITCH SPOTS.
ANYTHING TO STOP
THIS DISCUSSION.

OK. BODY SWITCHING
IS A SPELL

WHERE TWO PEOPLE CAN
SWITCH BODIES
WITH EACH OTHER.

FOR INSTANCE, ALEX,
YOU AND JUSTIN
CAN SWITCH BODIES.

WHY WOULD I WANT
TO DO THAT?

I CAN ALREADY DO
MORE PULL-UPS THAN HIM.

YEAH. WELL, I'D
SWITCH BODIES
WITH CHUCK NORRIS,

DO MORE PULL-UPS,
AND GIVE YOU
A ROUNDHOUSE KICK.

YOU JUST ADMITTED
I CAN DO MORE PULL-UPS
THAN YOU.

OK. NOW THIS IS
A TRICKY SPELL

BECAUSE IF YOU DON'T
SWITCH BACK BEFORE SUNDOWN,

YOU'LL BE TRAPPED IN THE OTHER
PERSON'S BODY FOREVER
WITH NO WAY OUT.

AND THEN YOU'LL
BE A VAMPIRE,

AND YOU'LL HAVE TO
DRINK BLOOD!

YOU REALLY HAVE TO START
READING THE HANDOUTS.

ALEX, LET'S GIVE IT A TRY
WITH ME AND YOU.

NOW JUST SAY
THE TWO
PEOPLE'S NAMES
AND THEN THIS...

CAMBIA CORPORUM
MEUM CORPORA
SUA NOMINAVI.

ALL RIGHT.
ALEX, JERRY,

CAMBIA CORPORUM
MEUM CORPORA
SUA NOMINAVI.
WHOA!

EXCELLENT, ALEX.
YOU EXECUTED
THE SPELL PERFECTLY.

OH. MAYBE YOUR MOM'S RIGHT.
I COULD DROP A COUPLE POUNDS.

WHY IS IT SO HOT
IN HERE?

MAN, YOU HAVE
A LOT OF HAIR.

SMOOTH, SCRATCHY.
SMOOTH, SCRATCHY.

ALEX, LEAVE
MY FACE ALONE.

YOU GUYS GET
THE IDEA.
NOW SWITCH US BACK.

LATER. I'VE GOT A LITTLE
SHOPPING TO DO FIRST.

YOU DON'T HAVE
ANY MONEY.
NO, BUT YOU DO.

BUT YOU JUST--
I JUST PUT YOU--
I JU--ALEX!

♪ WELL, YOU KNOW EVERYTHING'S
GONNA BE A BREEZE ♪

♪ THAT THE END WILL, NO DOUBT,
JUSTIFY THE MEANS ♪

♪ YOU CAN FIX ANY PROBLEM
WITH THE SLIGHTEST OF EASE ♪
♪ YES, PLEASE ♪

♪ BUT YOU MIGHT FIND OUT
IT'LL GO TO OUR HEAD ♪

♪ WHEN YOU WRITE A REPORT
ON A BOOK YOU NEVER READ ♪

♪ WITH A SNAP OF YOUR FINGERS,
YOU CAN MAKE YOUR BED ♪
♪ THAT'S WHAT I SAID ♪

♪ EVERYTHING
IS NOT WHAT IT SEEMS ♪

♪ WHEN YOU CAN GET
ALL YOU WANTED ♪
♪ IN YOUR WILDEST DREAMS ♪

♪ YOU MIGHT RUN INTO TROUBLE
IF YOU GO TO EXTREMES ♪

♪ BECAUSE EVERYTHING
IS NOT WHAT IT SEEMS ♪

♪ EVERYTHING IS NOT
WHAT IT SEEMS ♪

♪ WHEN YOU CAN HAVE
WHAT YOU WANT ♪
♪ BY THE SIMPLEST OF MEANS ♪

♪ BE CAREFUL NOT TO MESS
WITH THE BALANCE OF THINGS ♪

♪ BECAUSE EVERYTHING
IS NOT WHAT IT SEEMS ♪
NICE TRY, LITTLE GIRL.

WHAT? I CHANGED US BACK
AS SOON AS YOU CAUGHT ME.

I CAUGHT YOU
AT THE REGISTER
AT THE MALL.

OH. HARPER, WHAT
ARE YOU DOING?

PLANNING YOUR
QUINCEAÑERA.

OH, MY GOSH.
AM I SICK?

WHAT'S
A QUINCEAMONO?

IT'S A PARTY CELEBRATING
A GIRL'S COMING OF AGE.

THAT'S WHY YOUR GRANDMOTHER'S
COMING TO TOWN.

YOU GET TO WEAR
A PINK BEAUTIFUL DRESS.

AND IT'S
A LATIN AMERICAN TRADITION

THAT COMES FROM THE WORDS
QUINCE, MEANING 15,
AND AÑO MEANING YEAR

AND ERA, WHICH JUST
MAKES IT SOUND SPANISH.

YEAH. I'M SORRY.
EVERYTHING AFTER
PINK DRESS

WAS JUST
"YUCK, YUCK, YUCK."

BUT THERE ARE RITUALS
SYMBOLIZING YOUR
BECOMING A WOMAN

THAT YOU GO THROUGH
WITH YOUR DAD.

WHAT? I DIDN'T GIVE
ANYBODY PERMISSION
TO BECOME A WOMAN.

I'M WITH DAD.
YOU KNOW ME.

I DON'T DO ANYTHING
DAD DOESN'T WANT
ME TO DO.

WELL, LOOK.
I LOVE BEING
HALF MEXICAN

AND HALF
WHATEVER HE IS--

ITALIAN. ITALIAN.
I TELL YOU THAT

EVERY TIME YOU ORDER
PINEAPPLE ON YOUR PIZZA.

THE POINT IS,
LOOK AT ALL
THIS STUFF.

IT'S ALL TOO GIRLY
AND LAME.
NO, THANKS.

YOU'LL COME AROUND
BECAUSE FOR THE DRESS

I'VE EMBRACED
TRADITIONAL
MEXICAN EMBROIDERY.

THE SHAWL WILL BE
OVERNIGHTED
FROM OAXACA, MEXICO.
WHAT DO YOU THINK?

I THINK YOU SOUND
LIKE YOU'RE CHOKING

WHEN YOU SAY,
"OAXACA,"

BUT MAYBE I COULD
SPILL A LITTLE
PAINT ON IT

AND RIP IT,
AND THEN I'LL
CALL IT A DRESS,

AND WHEN I'M DONE,
IT WILL GO GREAT
WITH THESE.

Theresa: NO, NO, NO.
THERE'S A RITUAL

WHERE YOU CHANGE
FROM A FLAT SHOE
TO A HIGH-HEEL SHOE.

WELL, MAYBE I CAN
CHANGE FROM THESE
HIGH-TOPS

TO EVEN HIGHER
HIGH-TOPS.
NO, ALEX!

THERE ARE CERTAIN
THINGS THAT PEOPLE DO
AT A QUINCEAÑERA,

AND WE'RE GOING TO
DO THEM.

IF I CAN'T WEAR MY
SNEAKERS

AND I HAVE
TO WEAR THAT,
THEN WE'RE NOT.

ALEX, YOU CAN'T
CANCEL.

A LOT OF WORK HAS
GONE INTO THIS.

IT'S MY PARTY.
I CAN CANCEL
IF I WANT TO.

IT'S NOT JUST
YOUR PARTY.
IT'S OUR PARTY.

OH, YEAH?
WELL, IT SEEMS LIKE

IT'S MOSTLY
JUST ABOUT YOU.

IF I SEE SO MUCH
AS A SCRATCH ON THAT BIKE,
SOMEONE'S GONNA EAT SPOKES.
GRANDMA!
LEXIE! OH.

MAMA.
MIJA. OH.
HEY. AND HARPO.

HERE WE GO AGAIN.
IT'S HAR-PER.

HI, GRANDMA.
YEAH. HI.

HOW WAS YOUR
BICYCLE TOUR
AROUND NEW ENGLAND?
IT WAS LONG.

I WAS WORRIED
THAT THE NEXT TIME

I SAW THAT
BICYCLE SEAT

WAS GONNA BE IN ONE
OF MY X-RAYS.

HEY. WHERE ARE
JUSTIN AND MAX?

I LEARNED A NEW
WRESTLING MOVE.

I WANT TO TRY IT
OUT ON THEM.

JERRY, THAT'S
THE WAY I LEFT YOU
A YEAR AGO, EATING.
HI, MAGDALENA.

AND FOR YOUR INFORMATION,
I LOST 5 POUNDS.

PULL UP YOUR SHIRT.
I THINK I
FOUND THEM.

SO HOW'S THE PARTY PLANNING
GOING, GIRLS?

THEY'RE VERY
SENSITIVE WHEN YOU

MAKE FUN
OF MY WEIGHT.

I TALKED
TO YOUR MOM.

SHE THINKS YOUR
DAD COULD DROP
5 POUNDS, TOO.

SHE'S MOSTLY UPSET
ABOUT YOU.
EH, SHE'LL GET OVER IT.

WELL, I HAVEN'T
SEEN HER THIS UPSET

SINCE SHE WAS 15
AND SHE ASKED

IF SHE COULD HAVE
A QUINCEAÑERA

AND WE COULDN'T
AFFORD IT.

SHE WANTED ONE,
AND SHE COULDN'T
HAVE ONE?
YEAH.

IS THAT WHY SHE WANTS
ME TO HAVE ONE SO BAD?

I DON'T KNOW, MIJA.
MAYBE YOU'RE RIGHT.

MAYBE SHE FIGURED
AT LEAST SHE'D GET
TO HAVE ONE FOR YOU.

BUT IT'S JUST NOT ME.
I REALLY DON'T WANT ONE.

BUT THAT DOESN'T MEAN
SHE CAN'T HAVE ONE.

DON'T BE SILLY.
YOUR MOTHER CAN'T
HAVE A QUINCEAÑERA.

SHE'D HAVE TO BE
A 15-YEAR-OLD GIRL.

STRANGER THINGS
HAVE HAPPENED.

NO. SERIOUSLY,
THEY HAVE.

HEY, DAD.
WHERE'S MOM?

DOING WHAT
SHE ALWAYS DOES
WHEN SHE'S UPSET--

VENTING TO CUSTOMERS
ABOUT WHAT'S WRONG
WITH HER LIFE.

I MEAN, IT'S NOT LIKE
I HAVE ANOTHER DAUGHTER

I COULD GIVE MY
HOPES AND DREAMS
TO, YOU KNOW?
ANYWAY, CORNED BEEF?

HEY, MOM. GOOD NEWS.
I CHANGED MY MIND.

I WANT A PARTY
AFTER ALL.
WHAT? WE'RE NOT READY.

I THOUGHT WE AGREED--
NO WOMANHOOD.

OH, MY GOSH. YOU DO,
YOU REALLY DO?
AAH! I'M SO EXCITED!

IT'S GONNA BE PERFECT
AS LONG AS IT'S
OVER BY SUNDOWN.
WHY SUNDOWN?

BECAUSE I HEAR
THAT YOU CAN GET

THE BANQUET ROOMS
FOR CHEAPER.

YEAH. THAT'S
WHAT I HEARD. GOOD.

OH, HONEY, I'M
SO EXCITED.
IT'S GONNA BE GREAT.

YOU'RE GONNA LOOK
BEAUTIFUL.

YOU'RE GONNA HAVE
A SPECIAL DANCE

WITH EACH ONE
OF YOUR BROTHERS.
WAIT A MINUTE.

I HEARD DANCING
AND BROTHERS.

I SIGNED YOU UP
FOR A COUPLE

OF BALLROOM DANCE
LESSONS

SO YOU'LL BE READY
FOR ALEX'S QUINCEAÑERA.

SO THESE TWO EGGHEADS
HAVE TO DANCE?

I THOUGHT DAD MADE
A RULE AGAINST HER
BEING A WOMAN.

WELL, I THOUGHT DAD
MADE A RULE AGAINST HER
CALLING US EGGHEADS.

SO I GUESS
THIS WOMANHOOD TRAIN

IS CLEARLY LEAVING
WITHOUT ME.

LOOK. AS A FATHER,
I AM NOT GONNA
BE LEFT BEHIND,
SO I'M ON BOARD.
NO, I'M NOT!

OK, CLASS.
ON TO SOMETHING

THAT ALL BUT TWO
OF YOU CAN DO.
THE SALSA.

OOH! SALSA.
WERE WE SUPPOSED
TO BRING CHIPS?

THIS DOOR SHOULD
OPEN OUT.

HI, BOYS. I CAME
TO PICK UP
MY GRANDSONS.

BUT, GRANDMA, WE'RE
ABOUT TO SALSA.

IT'S NOT JUST
A ZESTY DIP.

SO THESE TWINKLE TOES
ARE GONNA TEACH YOU
HOW TO SALSA?

OH, FINE. I LOVE
A GOOD COMEDY.
AHEM. RICHARD.

AND ADD
THE 3-STEP SPIN.

WAIT, WAIT, WAIT.
YOU CALL THAT
A SALSA?

IT LOOKS MORE LIKE
YOU'RE TRYING TO GET
GUM OFF YOUR SHOE.

MAYBE IT WOULD BE
BETTER IF YOU ALL LEFT.

FINE. I'LL TEACH
MY GRANDSONS
HOW TO SALSA.

BUT, GRANDMA, MOM
EXPECTS US TO LEARN
HOW TO DANCE.

IF I CAN MAKE SALSA,
I CAN DANCE THE SALSA.
YOU'VE HEARD THE SAYING--

YOU DANCE
WHAT YOU EAT.

UM, GRANDMA, IT'S
YOU ARE WHAT YOU EAT.

DO YOU KNOW
HOW TO DANCE?

NO.
THEN SHUT UP.
1, 2, 3, WRESTLE!
YOU LOOK BEAUTIFUL!
YEAH. PINK AND PUFFY.
REALLY PINK AND PUFFY.

BUT IT'S OK BECAUSE
I'M NOT GONNA BE
THE ONE WEARING IT.

YOU ARE.
ALEX, THERESA,

CAMBIA CORPORUM
MEUM CORPORA
SUA NOMINAVI.
ARE YOU DOING MAGIC?

OHH!
OHH!
WHOA.

WH--WHY AM I LOOKING
AT MYSELF?

WELL, YOU MAY BE
LOOKING AT YOURSELF
ON THE OUTSIDE,

BUT IT'S ME
ON THE INSIDE.
HI, MOM.

YOU'RE--YOU'RE
IN MY BODY?

YEP, AND YOU'RE
IN MY BODY.

YOU ARE GROUNDED
AS SOON AS YOU GET BACK
IN THIS BODY

BECAUSE I AM NOT
GROUNDING MYSELF.

ALEXANDRA
MARGARITA RUSSO,

YOU PROMISED YOUR FATHER
YOU WOULDN'T DO MAGIC

WHILE YOUR
GRANDMOTHER'S VISITING.

MOM, I KNOW
YOU'RE MAD,

BUT JUST
HEAR ME OUT.

THIS IS THE ONLY WAY
YOU CAN ENJOY
THE QUINCEAÑOMA

YOU'VE
ALWAYS WANTED,

AND THEN
IF YOU'RE MAD,

WELL, THEN
PUNISH ME.
IT'S OK. FINE.
IT'S QUINCEAÑERA!

OH, MY GOSH!
I LOVE THIS DRESS!

I'M SO PINK AND PUFFY.
I'M 15 AGAIN!

THAT'S RIGHT, MOM.
YOU'RE 15 AGAIN.
OH. I'M SORRY.

DON'T BE SORRY.
THIS IS FANTASTIC.

I'M HAVING
A QUINCEAÑERA!

YOU THINK WE CAN
PULL THIS OFF.

TRUST ME. IT
WOULD NOT BE
THE FIRST TIME

I GOT AWAY
WITH MAGIC.

I MEAN, IT WOULD
TOTALLY BE
THE FIRST TIME.

ALEX.
WHAT?

NO. YOU DON'T
MEAN WHAT.
I MEAN WHAT. WHAT?

OH, I TALKED
TO YOUR MOM,

AND SHE DECIDED
THAT IT WAS OK

FOR YOU TO WEAR
THE SHOES THAT
YOU WANTED.

OH, MY GOSH!
WHEN WERE YOU
GONNA TELL ME?

HEH. I WAS GONNA TELL YOU
BEFORE THE THING HAPPENED.

BEFORE THE THING
THAT JUST HAPPENED?
YES. THE BIG THING.
OH.
WHAT BIG THING?

OH. NOTHING.
I JUST DECIDED

THAT I'M VERY OK
WITH WEARING HIGH HEELS
AND THIS TIARA.

I LOOK LIKE
A PRINCESS.

GRANDMA, DON'T YOU THINK
YOU SHOULD TEACH US
HOW TO DANCE NOW?

WE'VE BEEN TELLING MOM
THAT WE'VE BEEN GOING
TO LESSONS.

DON'T WORRY.
THERE'S PLENTY
OF TIME
FOR DANCE LESSONS.

WHEN?
THE QUINCEAÑERA IS NOW.
OH. WHOA!

TIME GOT AWAY
FROM ME, EH?

I NEED TO GET
ALEX A PRESENT.

MAX, YOU GO FIND ME
SOME SCOTCH TAPE,

AND, JUSTIN, YOU GO
FIND ME SOME
WRAPPING PAPER.

OH. UH, EXCUSE ME, MA'AM.
YOU KNOW, THAT NECKLACE

REALLY DOESN'T GO
WITH YOUR OUTFIT.

OH, I KNOW.
HOW ABOUT I BUY
IT OFF OF YOU?

WHAT ARE WE GONNA
DO NOW?

YOU KNOW, I DIDN'T
WANT IT TO HAVE
TO COME TO THIS,

BUT THERE'S ONLY
ONE WAY OUT.

WE HAVE TO BREAK
EACH OTHER'S LEGS.
OK. ME FIRST.
YOU GOT IT.
ATTENTION, EVERYONE.

I PRESENT TO YOU
MY DAUGHTER ALEX RUSSO.

THANK YOU SO MUCH, EVERYONE,
FOR COMING TO MY QUINCEAÑERA.

I JUST LOVE SAYING,
"MY QUINCEAÑERA."

EVERYONE, ALL TOGETHER,
"MY QUINCEAÑERA!"
MY QUINCEAÑERA!

WOW! ALEX IS
REALLY INTO THIS.

NOT TO TAKE
ALL THE CREDIT,

BUT I ALWAYS KNEW
I COULD CHANGE HER.

WHAT? YOU KNOW I JUST
LIKE TO EAT THE ICING.

SO DOES ALEX.
NOW I KNOW WHERE
SHE GETS IT FORM.
YEAH.

AND NOW IT'S TIME
FOR THE SYMBOLIC
SHOE CEREMONY.
WHOO-HOO!

Jerry: FIRST,
I WILL REMOVE
ALEX'S FLAT SHOES,

AND THEN I WILL PUT ON
THESE HIGH-HEEL SHOES.
GET YOUR OWN, MISTER!

WHAT I MEANT IS,
I WILL PUT THESE
HIGH-HEEL SHOES ON ALEX

TO SYMBOLIZE A GIRL
BECOMING A WOMAN.
WHOO!
MOM.
YES, SON?

WE GOT KICKED OUT
OF DANCE CLASS.

WE NEVER LEARNED
HOW TO DANCE.

WE'RE GONNA LOOK LIKE
COMPLETE FOOLS OUT THERE.

YOU EGGHEADS!
YOU'RE GONNA RUIN
THIS WHOLE THING.

WAIT A MINUTE.
EGGHEADS,

EATING THE ICING
OFF THE CUPCAKE,
YOUR LIP,
AND THOSE HIGH-TOPS!

OHH!
THE BODY SWITCHING SPELL.

YOU SWITCHED BODIES
WITH MOM, DIDN'T YOU, ALEX?

SHH! KEEP IT DOWN,
NIMROD!
NIMROD? ALEX.

THAT MEANS MOM'S
OUT THERE.

THAT MEANS WE'RE GONNA
HAVE TO DANCE WITH HER
AND BE GOOD.

OK. UM--OK,
HOW ABOUT I DO
THE ROBOT

AND YOU PRETEND
TO OIL ME?
NO, YOU EGGHEAD.

WE CAN SWITCH BODIES
WITH SOMEONE, TOO--
THE DANCE INSTRUCTORS.

ATTENTION, EVERYONE.
JUSTIN AND MAX

HAVE PREPARED
TO DANCE WITH ALEX.

MAX, CANDACE...
JUSTIN, RICHARD...

Both: CAMBIA CORPORUM
MEUM CORPORA
SUA NOMINAVI.
WHOA!
WHAT AM I DOING HERE?

I DON'T KNOW,
BUT LIKE ALL

THE OTHER
TROUBLE SPOTS I'VE

GOTTEN INTO
IN MY LIFE,

I'M GONNA DANCE
MY WAY OUT.
[SALSA MUSIC PLAYING]

DO YOU KNOW HOW
TO SALSA?
YES, I DO.

IF YOU WERE
15 YEARS OLDER,

I WOULD ASK YOU
TO DINNER, MI AMOR.

OK. THAT'S
REALLY WEIRD.

IT'S TIME
FOR THE BIG FINALE.
LEAP INTO MY ARMS.
REALLY?
I'VE GOT YOU, BABY.

ARMS DOWN.
HOLD IT, GIRL.
THAT'S IT!
YOU'RE A SWAN!
I'M A SWAN!
WHOO! WHOO!

WHOA.
WHOA.

WE MADE IT BACK
BY SUNDOWN.

DID ALEX AND MOM
SWITCH BACK YET?
I DON'T THINK SO.

ALEX, THE SUN
IS GOING DOWN.

SUNDOWN? I'VE GOT
TO SWITCH BACK,

OR I'LL BE STUCK
IN MOM'S BODY FOREVER.

THANKS, BRO.
ALEX, THERESA,

CAMBIA CORPORUM
MEUM--
THERESA.
OH--UH, MA.

YOU KNOW, YOUR FATHER
ALWAYS WANTED TO GIVE
A SPEECH
AT YOUR QUINCEAÑERA.
HE EVEN WROTE ONE,

AND NOW THAT WE ARE
HERE AT YOUR DAUGHTER'S,

I'M GOING TO READ IT
TO YOU.

"MY DEAREST DAUGHTER
THERESA,

"WHEN YOU WERE BORN
AT 6:02 P.M.,

"IT WAS

I KNEW BECAUSE I HADN'T
FIXED THE ROOF YET."
SO HOW MANY PAGES?

I DON'T KNOW.
LIKE, 30.

YOU KNOW, HE WAS ALWAYS
FIXING THAT ROOF.
ALWAYS, HUH?
OOPS! UM, I'M A KLUTZ.

OH. WELL, THAT'S
ALL RIGHT, MAXIMILIAN,
BECAUSE YOU KNOW WHAT?
I HAVE IT MEMORIZED.
OH.

I JUST WOULD HOLD
THE PAPERS

FOR, YOU KNOW, THAT SORT

LET'S SEE NOW.
WHERE WAS I,
WHERE WAS I?

OH. OH, YES.
THE ROOF. THE ROOF.

OK. "AND THEN
WHEN YOU STARTED WALKING,

"I HEARD THE PITTER-PATTER
OF BOTH YOUR FEET AND RAIN.

"I STILL HADN'T
FIXED THE ROOF.

HEY, HEY, UH, GRANDMA.
YOU WANT TO WRESTLE NOW?

NO. IN A MINUTE,
OK, MIJO?

THIS IS A VERY IMPORTANT
EMOTIONAL MOMENT.

YOU'RE CHICKEN?

START FROM THE VERY TOP.

WE'RE SUPPOSED

BAWK, BAWK!
BA-GAW! BAWK!
OH, IT'S ON!

OH. IT'S NOT FAIR.

OH. UH, ALEX, THERESA,
CAMBIA CORPORUM

MEUM CORPORA
SUA NOMINAVI.

WHOA!
WHOA!
AHH.
OW!

THESE HIGH HEELS
ARE LAME.
GET THEM OFF ME.
SHE'S BACK.

ALEX, I JUST WANT TO
THANK YOU

BECAUSE THE QUINCEAÑERA
WAS EVERYTHING I HOPED FOR.

YOU KNOW, GRANDMA
WAS READING ME
THIS LETTER

THAT GRANDPA
WROTE FOR YOU.

YOU SHOULD
REALLY HEAR IT.

OH. THE ONE
ABOUT THE LEAKY ROOF?

HE READ THAT
FOR EVERYTHING--
BIRTHDAYS, WEDDINGS.

HE EVEN READ IT
WHEN HE WON 10 BUCKS
OFF A LOTTO SCRATCHIER.

OH. WELL, I'M GLAD
YOU LIKED IT,

AND I'M GLAD
IT'S OVER.

WELL, IT'S NOT OVER
YET, YOUNG LADY.

IT'S TIME FOR
THE FATHER-DAUGHTER DANCE.

OH, ALEX, YOU REALLY
ARE GROWING UP.

YOU DID ALL THIS
FOR YOUR MOTHER,

AND LOOK HOW HAPPY
IT MADE HER.

I'M GLAD WE DID THIS,
TOO, DAD.

YOU REALLY ARE
TURNING INTO
A WONDERFUL WOMAN
JUST LIKE HER.

I AM SO PROUD
OF YOU, HONEY.

EVEN WHEN I BREAK
THE RULES AND USE MAGIC
BEHIND YOUR BACK?
EVEN THEN.

OH, HONEY,
ARE YOU CRYING?

YEAH, BUT WHY
AREN'T YOU?

YOU'VE BEEN CRYING
FOR DAYS.

WELL, I THINK I'M
ALL CRIED OUT.

REALLY? WHAT IF I

COST?

OH, MY GOSH!
HERE IT GOES AGAIN.

MANAGED TO REFRAIN

FROM USING MAGIC
THE WHOLE TIME
GRANDMA'S BEEN HERE.
YOU'RE WELCOME.
IT WASN'T EASY.

IT TOOK A LOT

BUT YOU SHOULD REALLY
PAT YOURSELVES ON THE BACK.

WELL, I'VE NEVER BEEN
IN THIS ROOM BEFORE.

WOW! IS THIS ROOM
WHAT I THINK IT IS?

WHAT ROOM DO YOU
THINK IT IS?
HMM. THE WRESTLING ROOM?
BEST 2 OUT OF 3!
